cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 300 mi SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to slow, then drift west-northwest and approach the upper Texas coast early next week before turning north-eastward across Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas coast between Port O’Connor and High Island

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches extend from east of High Island, TX to Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge watch Port Mansfield, TX to High Island, TX; Hurricane watch Port Aransas, TX to High Island, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Gulf Coast from south Texas through coastal Louisiana; secondary impacts possible along the Mississippi coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible Tuesday-Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (≤1 ft) possible with persistent on-shore flow; significant surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate rain Tuesday-Wednesday could total 1-3 inches locally
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip-current risk along Mississippi barrier islands
